findings.title: H1: Unhandled return value
findings.description: In the `tradeSend()` function there is unchecked return value of the `_tradeSrc()` which returns the result of the low-level call to Uniswap V2 router, which could fail and return `false` instead of `revert`.

findings.title: L1: Payload manipulation
findings.description: `tradeData` in the `_receiveTrade()` inside the `assembly` code on the destination chain can be manipulated by the user from the source chain using `inputPos` and `amount` values.

findings.title: L2: Unchecked transfer
findings.description: The contract uses unchecked ERC20.transferFrom(). It can be a problem in the case of non-standard ERC-20 tokens, which do not return the bool value.

findings.title: W1: Code duplication
findings.description: Duplicated code decreases the readability of the code and increases the space for human errors.

findings.title: W2: Renounce ownership
findings.description: The `renounceOwnership()` function can be accidentally called, leading to loss of contract ownership.

findings.title: W3: Missing unit tests
findings.description: The project is completely missing the unit tests which can discover many hidden issues in the system and avoid human errors during routine refactoring.

findings.title: W4: External mint function
findings.description: The SquidToken.sol contract contains an external mint() function with a comment indicating it is for testing purposes, which may or may not be intended for public release.

findings.title: I1: Commented out code
findings.description: In DistributionENSExecutable, there is a commented out code.

findings.title: I2: State variable access
findings.description: The `gasReceiver` variable can be marked as `immutable` and its visibility should be considered.

findings.title: I3: Missing code documentation
findings.description: The code is missing detailed documentation.
